title: Relic Shield's "Execute minions Below 'x' Health" Does not trigger with Thresh
body:
When playing thresh (as I main support) I've notice that currently relic shield's first trigger "Execute minions below 'x' Health with a basic attack" does not happen during thresh's AutoAttack or his Flay. (Note that the description mentions only basic attacks trigger it, However Leona's W can trigger it twice at once) Also worth noting that if Thresh Last hits a minion, that the Goldshare will still happen.

-GangreneElbow

replies.body:
"UNIQUE - SPOILS OF WAR: **Melee** autoattacks execute minions below 200 (+100% AD) health." 

Key word there is melee, Thresh's attacks are ranged =)

" Killing a minion by any means heals you and the nearest allied champion for 40 health and grants them gold equal to the kill. "

Leona's W is AOE so it should be able to use up multiple stacks if she kills minions with W. It will not execute the minions though. (Leona's W does do quite a bit of damage at times so it may seem like it is executing but it isnt. MAGIC DAMAGE: 60 / 110 / 160 / 210 / 260 (+ 40% AP))

Hope that clears things up!

You know, that gets me thinking. What exactly classifies an attack as "melee"? It couldn't just be within a certain range of attack, because the different melee characters have different ranges (eg. Xin Zhao has more range than Nunu, but both are melee, and then there's Gangplank). And it couldn't be that melee attacks do not fire projectiles because of the existence of autos such as Vel'koz's or Thresh's.

So what technically makes an attack melee in game terms?

So I don't have the most technical answer. But whether a champion is melee or not isn't determined by range. They either are or aren't kind of like a check box thing.

Usually they are pretty intuitive though.

Oh, so it's a trait that is assigned to each champion, not something decided by the game's mechanics.

Just a bit confused, because at least in real life, if you fire a gun at point blank, even though it's a ranged weapon, you're using it as melee.
Yes but it doesn't make it a Melee weapon.
This is usually why I get E at level 1 (and again at level 4) - the passive on it really helps last hitting with Relic Shield!
